pages.title: ORSA Transponder
pages.text: The transponder is ORSA's last-resort emergency beacon. Once activated, it broadcasts a deep-space signal to surviving relay satellites.$(br2)Building one requires the $(bold)ORSA Transponder Schematic$() — a classified document found in ORSA wreckage.$(br2)$(italic)"We hid the escape plan in a random structure on a dying planet." — ORSA Security$(br)"We also hid the cafeteria key. We're not great at this."$()
4 Refined Acheronite, 2 Diamond Blocks, a Thermal Core, Frozen Heart, and a Frozen Atmosphere Shard. You're building a phone call to space. Long distance rates apply.

pages.title: Activation Requirements
pages.text: $(li)$(bold)Depth:$() Below Y=0 for the deep relay network$(li)$(bold)Power:$() Geothermal Core within 12 blocks$(li)$(bold)Sky Access:$() Clear vertical shaft to the sky — no solid blocks. Start digging.$(li)$(bold)Schematic:$() Must be archived first$(br2)Right-click to activate. Broadcast takes ~100 minutes. We recommend a book and warm beverage. You have neither. Sorry.

pages.title: During Broadcast
pages.text: A visible beam shoots upward through the shaft. The signal can be paused and resumed from the transponder's interface.$(br2)If conditions are lost during broadcast, it automatically pauses with a warning. It resumes when conditions are restored.$(br2)Snow is automatically cleared from the shaft by the signal energy. ORSA's most practical feature — designed entirely by accident.
